      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                             java.lang.Object targetDomainObject,
                             java.lang.Object permission)
        Specified by:
        hasPermission in interface org.springframework.security.access.PermissionEvaluator
        Parameters:
        authentication - Authentication The current #authentication from the SecurityContext
        targetDomainObject - String One of the WorkshopEntity.workshopEntitiesNames WorkshopEntity simple class names.
        permission - String as 'read', 'write' etc. Will be converted to PermissionType
        Returns:
        True if the current Authentication InternalAuthority.allAuthoritiesPermissions contains PermissionType for such kind of 'targetType'.

      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                             java.io.Serializable targetId,
                             java.lang.String targetType,
                             java.lang.Object permission)
        Specified by:
        hasPermission in interface org.springframework.security.access.PermissionEvaluator
        Parameters:
        authentication - Authentication The current #authentication from the SecurityContext
        targetId - Nullable
        targetType - String One of the WorkshopEntity.workshopEntitiesNames WorkshopEntity simple class names.
        permission - String as 'read', 'write' etc. Will be converted to PermissionType
        Returns:
        True if the current Authentication InternalAuthority.allAuthoritiesPermissions contains PermissionType for such kind of 'targetType'.

      • evaluateParameters

        private boolean evaluateParameters(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                   java.lang.Object targetDomainObject,
                                   java.lang.Object permission)
        Parameters:
        authentication - Cannot be null. It is inserted by SpringSecurity automatically, no need to specially pass it with SPeL expressions onto this method.
        targetDomainObject - If it is the instance of ServletWebRequest it is enough to obtain full info with evaluateServletWebRequest(Authentication, ServletWebRequest). In not, it may be String representation of WorkshopEntity as 'Task' or the object itself with mandatory overridden .toString() with the explicit name.
        permission - Non-null. String representation of PermissionType as 'post', 'get' etc.
        Returns:
        true of false depending on results.

      • evaluateServletWebRequest

        private boolean evaluateServletWebRequest(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                          org.springframework.web.context.request.ServletWebRequest webRequest)
        JavaDoc on private method as a reminder. ServletWebRequest object is the sufficient object to obtain all the information for securing a method. Its HttpMethod - is the analogue to PermissionType. Its part of the http path following the internal domain path is the potential name of the WorkshopEntity. And the Authentication is set automatically by Spring.

      • finalAuthenticationEvaluation

        private boolean finalAuthenticationEvaluation(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                              PermissionType permissionType,
                                              java.lang.String workshopEntityName)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
